title: Salve amulet

properties.name: description
properties.value: The salve amulet raises the wearer's Attack and Strength by 1/6th[1] while attacking undead monsters. It is a reward from the Haunted Mine quest. To make the salve amulet, a salve shard is cut using a chisel from a crystal outcrop at the bottom level of the Abandoned Mine, and strung with a ball of wool. The Lunar spell String Jewellery can also be used instead of wool.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Salve amulet
Salve amulet
Released21 December 2004 (Update)
MembersYes
Quest itemHaunted Mine
Properties
TradeableNo
EquipableYes
StackableNo
OptionsWear
DestroyDrop
ExamineIncreases the wearer's strength and accuracy by 15%[sic] when fighting the undead.
Values
Value1 coin
High alch0 coins
Low alch0 coins
Weight0.007 kg
Advanced data
Item ID4081

The salve amulet raises the wearer's Attack and Strength by 1/6th[1] while attacking undead monsters. It is a reward from the Haunted Mine quest. To make the salve amulet, a salve shard is cut using a chisel from a crystal outcrop at the bottom level of the Abandoned Mine, and strung with a ball of wool. The Lunar spell String Jewellery can also be used instead of wool.

The salve amulet's effects do not stack with the black mask's (and by extension, the Slayer helm's). If both are worn, the salve amulet's effects take priority. However, it does stack with the set effect of Void Knight equipment. Most monsters within the Nightmare Zone are not classed as undead and thus the salve amulet is ineffective against them; some monsters such as Trapped Soul and Headless Beast are exceptions.[2]

This amulet's bonus can be increased:

  • To 20% when made into a salve amulet (e).
  • To also get additional 1/6th damage and accuracy bonus to Ranged, and a 15% bonus to Magic for 800,000 Nightmare Zone points or 320 Soul Wars Zeal Tokens, when imbued into a salve amulet(i).

Both upgrades can be combined by turning either of them into a Salve amulet(ei).

Recovering your Salve Amulet: To recover one's salve amulet, crawl down the cart tunnel leading into the Haunted Mine. Once inside, crawl through the cart tunnel immediately south of the exit back outside. Use a chisel on any crystal outcrop to obtain salve shards, which can later be strung with balls of wool to make salve amulets.

Note: Players do not need to go through all six levels of the Haunted Mine, nor bring a light source to obtain a salve shard if they have completed the Haunted Mine quest.

 Attack bonuses

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
8 August 2019
(update)

Some brown patches near the salve shard around the amulet's inventory icon have been removed.

1 May 2014
(update)

The Salve amulet and its enchanted version can now be imbued at Nightmare zone for 800,000 points.

{{External|rs}} {{Infobox Item |name = Salve amulet |image = [[File:Salve amulet.png]] |release = [[21 December]] [[2004]] |update = The Haunted Mine |members = Yes |quest = [[Haunted Mine]] |tradeable = No |placeholder = Yes |equipable = Yes |stackable = No |noteable = No |options = Wear |destroy = Drop |examine = Increases the wearer's strength and accuracy by 15%{{Sic|actually 1/6th}} when fighting the undead. |value = 1 |weight = 0.007 |id = 4081 }} [[File:Salve amulet detail.png|left|150px]] The '''salve amulet''' raises the wearer's [[Attack]] and [[Strength]] by 1/6th{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1171387277655846913|date=10 September 2019|archiveurl=https://archive.is/QKT8B|archivedate=26 April 2020|quote=It's 1/6, so 16% is closer.}} while attacking [[undead]] monsters. It is a reward from the [[Haunted Mine]] quest. To make the salve amulet, a [[salve shard]] is cut using a [[chisel]] from a [[crystal outcrop]] at the bottom level of the [[Abandoned Mine]], and strung with a [[ball of wool]]. The [[Lunar spell]] [[String Jewellery]] can also be used instead of wool. The salve amulet's effects do not stack with the [[black mask]]'s (and by extension, the [[Slayer helm]]'s). If both are worn, the salve amulet's effects take priority. However, it does stack with the [[set effect]] of [[Void Knight equipment]]. Most monsters within the [[Nightmare Zone]] are not classed as undead and thus the salve amulet is ineffective against them; some monsters such as [[Trapped Soul]] and [[Headless Beast]] are exceptions.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/895337821103284224|date=9 August 2017|archiveurl=https://archive.vn/FRjGA|archivedate=26 April 2020|quote=I don't see any in the list that look like they'd be classed as undead.}} This amulet's bonus can be increased: * To 20% when made into a [[salve amulet (e)]]. * To also get additional 1/6th damage and accuracy bonus to [[Ranged]], and a 15% bonus to [[Magic]] for 800,000 Nightmare Zone points or 320 [[Soul Wars]] [[Zeal Tokens]], when [[imbued]] into a [[salve amulet(i)]]. Both upgrades can be combined by turning either of them into a [[Salve amulet(ei)]]. '''Recovering your Salve Amulet:''' To recover one's salve amulet, crawl down the cart tunnel leading into the Haunted Mine. Once inside, crawl through the cart tunnel immediately south of the exit back outside. Use a chisel on any crystal outcrop to obtain salve shards, which can later be strung with balls of wool to make salve amulets. '''Note:''' Players do not need to go through all six levels of the Haunted Mine, nor bring a light source to obtain a salve shard if they have completed the [[Haunted Mine/Quick guide|Haunted Mine]] quest. {{Infobox Bonuses |astab = 0 |aslash = 0 |acrush = 0 |amagic = 0 |arange = 0 |dstab = +3 |dslash = +3 |dcrush = +3 |dmagic = 0 |drange = 0 |str = 0 |rstr = 0 |mdmg = 0 |prayer = +3 |slot = neck |image = [[File:Salve amulet equipped.png|110px]] |altimage = [[File:Salve amulet equipped female.png|110px]] }} ==Creation== {{Recipe |skill1 = Crafting |skill1lvl = 35 |skill1boostable = Unknown |skill1exp = 0 |members = Yes |ticks = 2 |mat1 = Salve shard |mat1cost = no |mat2 = Ball of wool |output1 = Salve amulet |output1cost=no }} ==Products== {{Uses material list|Salve amulet}} ==Affected monsters== {{Bestiarytable|fromletter=A|toletter=Z|levelselect=no|levelsort=no|attribute=undead}} ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 8 August 2019 |update = Smithing and Silver Crafting Interfaces |poll = |change = Some brown patches near the salve shard around the amulet's inventory icon have been removed. }} {{Subject changes |date = 1 May 2014 |update = Spirit trees, clues & more! |change = The Salve amulet and its enchanted version can now be imbued at Nightmare zone for 800,000 points. }} {{Subject changes footer}} ===Gallery (historical)=== {|style="text-align: center" cellpadding="15" |[[File:Salve amulet (v1) detail.png|center|300x150px]] |[[File:Salve amulet detail.png|center|300x150px]] |- |[[File:Salve amulet v1.png|center]] |[[File:Salve amulet.png|center]] |- |21 December 2004 –
8 August 2019 |8 August 2019 –
present |} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Haunted Mine}} {{Amulets}} {{Prayer items}} {{Lair of Tarn Razorlor}}
